fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34917].
  {panel}

When label is set to space via API, it is set correctly, but *not shown in the UI*. This makes it impossible to remove label from space using other than remote API.  

As a clarification:
* The labels set via UI are shown correctly.
* Labels set via UI and/or API affect on dynamic listing correctly
* Label can be set and remote via API
* The issue is only in showing them in UI

Related discussions:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/324332/space-labelcategory-is-not-shown-in-ui-when-set-via-api
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/212369/how-to-remove-space-label-set-via-remote-api

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34900].
  {panel}

Indexing queue impacts performance or crashes the instance

We developed an external application and a plugin to suit our business requirement. These two applications create or modify pages. These actions may product a lot of entries in the indexing queue, which can result in the following:

* Crash of an instance
* Slowing down an instance significantly.
* Stopping processing the indexing queue

*Migration Utility (External Application)*
The utility runs on the desktops of the users to convert and migrate content from a different content management dystem to Confluence wiki.

We are using the following SOAP calls in this migration utility:
* store page
* move page
* upload labels
* upload attachments

*Search/Replace Plugin*
This plugin helps you search and replace strings or macros within a space and replace them with new strings or macros.

We use DefaultPageManager to save new version of a page.

In both the cases, when the pages are added/updated/deleted in bulk (for example, more than 10K entries), the index is not clearing based on the flush interval. We are ending up restarting the server to clear the queue. In certain cases, it is crashing the Wiki.

Thanks,
Pavel
fields.summary: Indexing queue impacts performance or crashes the instance

$userAccessor.getUserByKey() function does not return the user information with the specified userkey provided.

h3. How to Reproduce:
# Login in as an administrator
# Go to _Confluence Admin_ > _Configurations_ > _User Macros_
# Select _Create a User Macro_
# Insert a _Macro Name_
# Insert a _Macro Title_
# Copy the following and paste into the _Template_:
{code}## @noparams

#set ($user = $userAccessor.getUserByName("admin"))
Hello, $user

#set ($user2 = $userAccessor.getUserByKey("2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003"))
Hello, $user2{code}
# Select _Save_
!user_macro.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Result:
{code}Hello, com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl@694fb33a[admin,2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003] Hello, com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl@694fb33a[admin,2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003] {code}

h3. Actual Result:
{code}Hello, com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceUserImpl@694fb33a[admin,2c9082884854da49014854dbe4ed0003] Hello, $user2 {code}
!result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: $userAccessor.getUserByKey() will not return the user with the specified userkey

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34892].
  {panel}

P2 add-ons used to be able to implement Confluence's SearchResultRenderer interface to display their content in a nicer way in search results.

For example, we at Gliffy used to utilize this hook so that diagrams in search results linked to preview images. Currently, since the hook is broken, the result link displays the JSON content of diagrams, which is obviously not useful to our users.

This functionality seems to be missing since Confluence 5.2. Here is a recent Atlassian answer which notes the removal: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/307952/create-a-search-result-renderer

Please put this functionality back in, or let us know what the new way to do this is. Thank you!

The current workaround is to click the gray Confluence page link below the search result description:

 !gliffy_diagram_search_result.png!
fields.summary: Confluence SearchResultRenderer missing since 5.2.3

fields.description:
When using the JIRA Issue Macro in Chrome Beta 38.0.2125.44, after performing a search to insert a JIRA issue, the Display options expands and pushes the search results up and out of the display area.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Download Chrome Beta 38.0.2125.44 from https://www.google.com/intl/en/chrome/browser/beta.html
# Insert a JIRA Issue macro
# Perform a search

h3. Expected behavior
The search results are displayed in the window. If you choose to expand the display options, it will expand over the search results.
!chrome_stable.tiff|thumbnail!

h3. Actual behavior
The display options are expanded, but instead of rendering over the search results it pushes them off the page entirely. 
!chrome_beta.tiff|thumbnail!

h3. Related Notes
* This does not affect the current stable build of Chrome
* Clicking the arrow to minimize the Display Options will render the display options over the search, and clicking it a second time will minimize it to the bottom as expected
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro Search Not Rendering Properly in Chrome Beta 38.0.2125.44

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34890].
  {panel}

h6.Summary

At the moment there are no ways for user or administrators to leave the default space permissions empty if they already assigned a group space admin permission.

h6.Steps to replicate
# Create a test group
# Navigate to General configuration > Space permissions
# Click Edit Permissions
# Add the test group and give that group space admin permission
# Click Save
# Edit permissions again and try to remove the Admin permission from the test group

*Expected result*
The Admin permission is removed from the test group.

*Actual result*
You're not able to remove that permission. This message shows in the UI: "You are not allowed to remove all the Administration Permissions for this space." This happens even if there were no other groups with the Admin permission before the test group was added.

h6.Workaround
Add the _confluence-administrators_ group and give them all permissions under Default Space Permissions. Then you can remove groups that have been given the "Admin" permission.
fields.summary: Able to Remove group that have been assign Space Admin permission in Default space permissions

fields.description:
h3.Steps to Reproduce

# Change the space theme to the Documentation Theme
# Create a page under the homepage of the space
# Create another page under the page created in step #3
# Navigate to the page created in step #3
# Search for any terms in the left navigation panel's (Documentation Theme) Search Box

Notice that regardless of which page you are currently viewing, whether it's the page created in step #3, or the page created in step #4, the ancestorID appended to the search is *always*, the ancestorID of the space's homepage

fields.description: When using the Windows Installer "custom Install" option. I changed the ports from 8090 to 8600. After installation, The installer indicates Confluence is running on 8600 and points to 8600 via the short cuts. However, Tomcat server is still configured to run on the default ports (8090).  Of course when you point the browser to the application on port 8600 - you are served a "Web Page Not Available" message.  When you point the browser to 8090 - it works just fine

The page restrictions should be extended to manage anonymous access.

Example:
# Create group A and group B
# Create user A and user B
# Add user A into group A and user B into group B
# Create a page called testing
# Restrict viewing to group A and to anonymous
# User from group A can see the page
# Anonymous can also see the page.

fields.description:
After [changing a username|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Changing+Usernames] in Confluence, the recently-updated macro does no longer identify the renamed user and puts "Anonymous" instead. This happens for changed which where made _after_ the renaming!

The Versioning information on the pages in question work flawless, so it has to be a problem with the updated recently macro.
fields.summary: Recently-updated macro can't resolve renamed User name

fields.description:
A spinner and disabling of the button should be the bare minimum here to ensure the user knows that the move is in progress and cannot accidentally instigate the same page move again (which can lead to CONF-35040 - database deadlock).

For safety it should be enforced for an instance that while a page is currently being moved no other user (including users on another node) should be able to instigate a move of the same page.

Note that the root problem can probably be considered the fact that the page move operation is so slow (CONF-35396).
fields.summary: The page move UI should provide feedback when the move is slow and multiple concurrent moves of the same page should be prevented

Thanks for Newcode Macro plugin.
This is not a bug but a improve request.

Please locate Expand/Collapse link of new code macro on the left side to improve usability.

h4. Situation / Reproduce

- A user works with wide screen (display).
- If user want to expand the code brock on the page, need to move scroll bar to find the expand link.

It's convenient, if the expand link locates on the left side, near the code title.
Or hope to toggle show / hide with double click action on the code brock's title bar.   
Please see attachment images.

I tried to customize confluence CSS to locate expand/collapse link on the left side, but I hope to improve this NewCode Macro itself.

Sincerely.
fields.summary: Locate Expand/Collapse link on the left side to improve usability

ancestorIds:5177346 AND foo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34861].
  {panel}

When you edit an issue's description on the task's page (eg. https://project.atlassian.net/browse/ID-001) and you want to save your changes, so you press Ctrl+S which brings up the save dialog in the latest Chrome. Ok, that's not you wanted, so you press the Escape button and you've lost your changes. It's very counterintuitive.

Suggestions:
  - map Ctrl+S to save changes
  - or if the user made changes don't discard them without any warning
  - (not prefered) or somehow block save dialog Esc to discard the changes
fields.summary: Issue editing, Ctrl+S brings up save dialog then Esc discards the changes

h5.Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a space (for example, "Test Space" with a key of "TS")
# The default page is created - for example: {{http://localhost:10552/confluence/display/TS/Test+Space+Home}}
# Copy the URL in your web browser
# In another browser (or incognito tab) paste the URL
# You're asked to log in - the URL fragment contains: {{http://localhost:10552/confluence/login.action?os_destination=/pages/viewpage.action?title=Test+Space+Home&spaceKey=TS
# After logging in, you're redirected to {{http://localhost:10552/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?title=Test+Space+Home&spaceKey=TS}}

Confluence should redirect to the URL that was provided before displaying the login screen.

fields.description:
I have Confluence/JIRA latest versions (self hosted).  Confluence gets its users from JIRA.  I created a new topic and then used the Tools/Share option to notify all of the new topic.  I used "jira-users" to send the message to.  It sent to everyone including disabled users.  I would expect the behavior to NOT send to disabled users.

*Steps to Reproduce in Confluence:*
# Create a user, and set to 'Disabled'
# Create a group and make this user a member of this group
# Share a page with the group 
This results in an email being sent to the inactive user

*Steps to Reproduce with a Crowd server handling user management:*
Same as above, but with the user and group coming from Crowd. Note that the equivalent of 'disabled' is 'inactive'.
fields.summary: Tools/Share sends e-mail to disabled users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34844].
  {panel}

In JIRA, there is an option to update the SMTP timeout through the UI.  We would like to see this option in Confluence as well.  

After logging in as and Administrator, under the 'Mail Servers' menu, select the option to 'Edit Mail Servers.'  There should be an option to set the number of milliseconds for timeout in this list.

There is a workaround, which involves updating the BANDANA Table, and can be found here: [SMTP Timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+To+Set+the+Confluence+SMTP+Timeout]

This issue relates to the following: 
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-130319
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-29033

Please note - When the mail settings are updated in any way, the workaround has to be re-executed.  Any changes causes the settings to revert to the default.
fields.summary: Set the Confluence SMTP Timeout Through the UI

fields.description:
1. Launch the installer for Confluence 5.6.1
2. On the initial setup screen, choose "Express", click "Next"
3. View the defaults, click "Back"
4. Custom is now selected by default. Click "Next"
5. The same screen as shown in step 2 is presented.

To get to the true custom installation, you must click "Back"
Then click "Express"
Then re-select "Custom"
Then everything proceeds as expected.

My assumption is that when the back button is pressed, the radio button being changed programmatically is not firing the event that changes your behind the scenes boolean.

Dear support, 

After looking over the documentation provided to your software I was not able to find a reasonable solution to my issue. 
I would call it a bug, but more of a flexibility requirement. 
The matter is based on a workaround i cannot seem to find. 
In the process of developing a step-by-step implementation guide, I must create a numbered sub-guide in a numbered list. 
The reason for the numbering within the list is due to the fact of the sub-guide being located on a separate page with appropriate numbering on screenshots, which is later included in a numbered list with the aid of the Expand Macro.

Now the main issue i am facing is that I am not able to create single nor page specific screenshots with numbered steps for my solution.
The only possible resolution to the obstacle that i have found is to place the contents of the include page into the expand macro and leave it out from the hierarchy.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34840].
  {panel}

Love the new Task List features in 5.5.4!  Using Due Dates, using the Task Report Blueprint (multiple views with different labels).  The features are certainly helping my team's productivity!

One thing that is missing (for me) is the ability to prioritize.

Use case: I have a member of my team that has been pulled off onto a fire drill project.  She has a backlog of tasks building up in Confluence and some truly are more urgent than others.  I have no way to prioritize these outside of utilizing some type of SOP in the task description (yuck!).

Implementation suggestion: While I would love to prioritize by drag and drop (a la Jira Agile), I fully understand this can be a bit misleading with all of the different task view - my tasks, my assigned tasks, this task report, that task report, etc.  Perhaps something like how Due Date is implemented?  Some prescribed keystroke to pull up a pre-set set list of priorities (H, M, L) or 1-10 or something.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Task List: Ability to prioritize tasks
Add the ability to comment a task (especially when setting it "completed")

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34837].
  {panel}

Since Confluence version 5.6, comments are sent in the background with Ajax and there won't be any page reloads when comments are sent. I think this feature was overdue - thanks for the implementation!

In my opinion, the next step would be to push comments directly to other users such that those don't have to reload the page to see new comments. With the increasing presence of WebSocket, the technical base would be given for this feature.

My question: can we expect this feature in the medium term? Or am I totally on the wrong track with this idea?

(Taken from: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/332109/pushing-comments-to-clients-websockets-for-comments)
fields.summary: Pushing comments to clients with WebSockets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-34824].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Summary
*Main issue:* When the Base URL of Confluence is changed, the some URLs in the Workbox notification tray will still show the old URL until Confluence is restarted.

*Secondary issue:* Furthermore, there is inconsistent behavior between the different links in the Workbox. If you receive a notification in Workbox that includes a link to a Confluence Page, or a link to a comment on a Page, it will use absolute links (which is building off of the old base URL) while all other links (Reply, Like, Stop Watching, etc) use relative links (built based on the _current URL_ being accessed)

h2. Example of discrepancy between links
An absolute link
!absolutelink.png|thumbnail!
A relative link
!relativelink.png|thumbnail!

h2. Reproduction steps:
# Receive a notification and note the URL of the "Open" link
# Change the base URL to something else
# View the notification tray and check the "Open" link again

h2. Expected behavior
All of the links should have been updated to use the new base URL, *or* all should be using the relative URL. That is, there should be consistency

h2. Actual behavior
Some links use relative links while others use absolute links (such as "Open") that still point to the old URL

h2. Workaround
Restarting Confluence will rebuild the absolute links to use the new Base URL. If you are on Confluence Data Center, you will need to make sure all nodes are shut down, then start each back up (that is, do not do a rolling restart).

This will address the new base URL issue, however it does not address the consistency issue.
fields.summary: Links in Workbox Notifications Not Consistent and Not Updated after Changing Base URL

fields.description:
When there are a large number of child pages and you are currently seeing another page in the same space using the Documentation Theme, Confluence move the window to the cursor of the current selected page instead of just showing the child pages from the top parent page.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Set up a Confluence 5.5.6.
# Import the Confluence-space-export-140027-38.xml.zip file (attached).
# Go to the newly imported space "Z Confluence Test Space"
# Click on B1 page in the left panel.
# Now click expand the A1 page so you can see the child pages.

h3. Expected Results:

Pages should be displayed under A1 without moving the cursor.

h3. Actual Results:

Cursor is moved to the B1 page, so in case you have a lot of child pages under A1 you will need to scroll up.

h4. Resolution:

Upgrade to Confluence 5.6.1 or latest.
fields.summary: Page tree moves the cursor to the current page in Documentation Theme.
